title: Font Like Lancome
content:
I'm crazy about the proprietary font that Typophage made for Lancome. Obviously I can't buy their font, since it's not for sale. Does anyone have ideas for another? I tried Civility, and it won't work for my project. Basically, I want the script to be huge and light on the page.

[http://www.typophage.com/fontes-exclusives/lancome.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214011326/http:/www.typophage.com/fontes-exclusives/lancome.html "http://www.typophage.com/fontes-exclusives/lancome.html")

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214011326im_/http:/www.typophage.com/images/stories/custom_fonts/lancome/lancome_use2.gif)
author: mothnyc

comments.content: It's more regular but [Finerliner](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214011326/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/linotype_finerliner_com_micro/) has the lightness.
This is for a fashion project, so i guess quirky is better than regular. Any other thoughts?

Sthurer, thank you to appreciate. Exclusive rights of the Lancôme Typeface stop in July 2009. After this date, a improved version of this font will be available in OpenType format with specifics ligatures features.

christophe badani  
 [www.typophage.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214011326/http:/www.typophage.com/ "www.typophage.com")

Thanks for the info badani, thats great news. Big props for making this unique font, I too have been drooling all over this ever since the first ad surfaced.

Too bad not all proprietary fonts have time limited exclusivity..
